page.title: 01THEN AND NOW IN DIPTFORD
page.content: History tells us that in the 185Os there were 75O people who lived in Diptford, and in 1939 the population decreased to 39O. The{population}was affected by the Great War and also because slate {quarrying} ceased in the area and people moved to the large towns. Fewer people were needed to work on farms therefore there were less jobs available. Then in 1981 it decreased down to 3OO. Now it is thought to go up again because people will like to live in the countryside and commute to work by car using the motorway.1OO years ago there used to be {shops} and five public houses and taverns,blacksmiths and a bakery, but now there is a General Store and Post Office.
